tool.name: TopPerc
tool.description: Facilitate input to Percolator and reintegrate.
tool.command:
TopPerc
#if $param_percolator_executable: -percolator_executable $param_percolator_executable #end if #if $param_in_target: -in_target $param_in_target #end if #if $param_in_decoy: -in_decoy $param_in_decoy #end if #if $param_out: -out $param_out #end if #if $param_enzyme: -enzyme "$param_enzyme" #end if #if $param_X: -X $param_X #end if #if $param_e: -e #end if #if $param_Z: -Z #end if #if $param_p: -p $param_p #end if #if $param_n: -n $param_n #end if #if $param_F: -F $param_F #end if #if $param_t: -t $param_t #end if #if $param_i: -i $param_i #end if #if $param_x: -x #end if #if $param_f: -f $param_f #end if #if $param_J: -J $param_J #end if #if $param_k: -k $param_k #end if #if $param_w: -w $param_w #end if #if $param_W: -W $param_W #end if #if $param_V: -V "$param_V" #end if #if $param_v: -v $param_v #end if #if $param_u: -u #end if #if $param_R: -R #end if #if $param_O: -O #end if #if $param_S: -S $param_S #end if #if $param_K: -K #end if #if $param_D: -D #end if #if $param_B: -B $param_B #end if #if $param_U: -U #end if #if $param_s: -s #end if #if $param_A: -A #end if #if $param_a: -a $param_a #end if #if $param_b: -b $param_b #end if #if $param_G: -G $param_G #end if #if $param_g: -g #end if #if $param_I: -I #end if #if $param_q: -q #end if #if $param_N: -N #end if #if $param_E: -E #end if #if $param_C: -C #end if #if $param_d: -d $param_d #end if #if $param_P: -P "$param_P" #end if #if $param_T: -T #end if #if $param_Y: -Y #end if #if $param_H: -H #end if #if $param_fido_truncation: -fido-truncation #end if #if $param_Q: -Q #end if #if $adv_opts.adv_opts_selector=='advanced': #if $adv_opts.param_force: -force #end if #end if

param.name: param_percolator_executable
param.label: Path to the percolator binary

param.name: param_in_target
param.label: Input target file

param.name: param_in_decoy
param.label: Input decoy file

param.name: param_enzyme
param.label: Type of enzyme: no_enzyme,elastase,pepsin,proteinasek,thermolysin,chymotrypsin,lys-n,lys-c,arg-c,asp-n,glu-c,trypsin

param.name: param_e
param.label: read xml-input format (pin) from standard input

param.name: param_Z
param.label: Include decoys (PSMs, peptides and/or proteins) in the xml-output

param.name: param_p
param.label: Cpos, penalty for mistakes made on positive examples
param.help: (-p) Set by cross validation if not specified

param.name: param_n
param.label: Cneg, penalty for mistakes made on negative examples
param.help: (-n) Set by cross validation if not specified

param.name: param_F
param.label: False discovery rate threshold to define positive examples in training
param.help: (-F) Set by cross validation if 0. Default is 0.01

param.name: param_t
param.label: False discovery rate threshold for evaluating best cross validation result and the reported end result

param.name: param_i
param.label: Maximal number of iterations

param.name: param_x
param.label: Quicker execution by reduced internal cross-validation

param.name: param_f
param.label: Fraction of the negative data set to be used as train set when only providing one negative set, remaining examples will be used as test set

param.name: param_k
param.label: Input file given in the deprecated pin-xml format generated by

param.name: param_W
param.label: Read initial weights to the given file

param.name: param_V
param.label: The most informative feature given as the feature name, can be negated to indicate that a lower value is bette

param.name: param_v
param.label: Set verbosity of output: 0=no processing info, 5=all, default is 2

param.name: param_u
param.label: Use unit normalization [0-1] instead of standard deviation normalization

param.name: param_R
param.label: Measure performance on test set each iteration

param.name: param_O
param.label: Override error check and do not fall back on default score vector in case of suspect score vecto

param.name: param_S
param.label: Setting seed of the random number generato

param.name: param_K
param.label: Retention time features calculated as in Klammer et al

param.name: param_D
param.label: Include description of correct features

param.name: param_U
param.label: Do not remove redundant peptides, keep all PSMS and exclude peptide level probabilities

param.name: param_s
param.label: skip validation of input file against xml schema

param.name: param_A
param.label: output protein level probabilities

param.name: param_a
param.label: Probability with which a present protein emits an associated peptide (to be used jointly with the -A option)
param.help: (-a) Set by grid search if not specified

param.name: param_b
param.label: Probability of the creation of a peptide from noise (to be used jointly with the -A option)
param.help: (-b) Set by grid search if not specified

param.name: param_G
param.label: Prior probability of that a protein is present in the sample ( to be used with the -A option)
param.help: (-G) Set by grid search if not specified

param.name: param_g
param.label: treat ties as if it were one protein (Only valid if option -A is active)

param.name: param_I
param.label: use pi_0 value when calculating empirical q-values (no effect if option Q is activated) (Only valid if option -A is active)

param.name: param_q
param.label: output empirical q-values and p-values (from target-decoy analysis) (Only valid if option -A is active)

param.name: param_N
param.label: disactivates the grouping of proteins with similar connectivity, for example if proteins P1 and P2 have the same peptides matching both of them, P1 and P2 will not be grouped as one protein (Only valid if option -A is active)

param.name: param_E
param.label: Proteins graph will not be separated in sub-graphs (Only valid if option -A is active)

param.name: param_C
param.label: it does not prune peptides with a very low score (~0.0) which means that if a peptide with a very low score is matching two proteins, when we prune the peptide,it will be duplicated to generate two new protein groups (Only valid if option -A is active)

param.name: param_d
param.label: Setting depth 0 or 1 or 2 from low depth to high depth(less computational time) of the grid search for the estimation Alpha,Beta and Gamma parameters for fido(Only valid if option -A is active)

param.name: param_P
param.label: Define the text pattern to identify the decoy proteins and/or PSMs, set this up if the label that identifies the decoys in the database is not the default (by default : random) (Only valid if option -A is active)

param.name: param_T
param.label: Reduce the tree of proteins (removing low scored proteins) in order to estimate alpha,beta and gamma faster.(Only valid if option -A is active)

param.name: param_Y
param.label: Use target decoy competition to compute peptide probabilities.(recommended when using -A)

param.name: param_H
param.label: Q-value threshold that will be used in the computation of the MSE and ROC AUC score in the grid search (recommended 0.05 for normal size datasets and 0.1 for big size datasets).(Only valid if option -A is active)

param.name: param_fido_truncation
param.label: Proteins with a very low score (< 0.001) will be truncated (assigned 0.0 probability).(Only valid if option -A is active)

param.name: param_Q
param.label: Uses protein group level inference, each cluster of proteins is either present or not, therefore when grouping proteins discard all possible combinations for each group.(Only valid if option -A is active and -N is inactive)

param.name: param_force
param.label: Overwrite tool specific checks

tool.help:
Facilitate input to Percolator and reintegrate.
For more information, visit http://ftp.mi.fu-berlin.de/OpenMS/release-documentation/html/UTILS_TopPerc.html
